label: Dais Records
description:
Highly touted producer Hiro Kone follows her Drew McDowell link-up with a crackshot 2nd solo LP of jagged, physical rhythms and kinetic synth structures rent in acres of noumenal space on ‘Pure Expenditure’

Working intently at the point where EBM and avant-garde electronics collide, Nicky Mao a.k.a. Hiro Kone has opened up a vivid new space for... more

title_full:
Drew McDowall x Hiro Kone

              (BANK Records NYC)
label: BANK Records NYC
description:
The Ghost of Georges Bataille is a superb, if unexpected, collaboration between erstwhile Coil member Drew McDowell and fellow NYC-based artist Nicky Mao a.k.a. Hiro Kone, slotting very neatly into the Bank Records NYC catalogue amid their roster including Wetware, Nick Klein and Bookworms.

Strung out in the ether between Alva Noto, Coil and... more

label: R&S Records
description:
New one from The Maghreban.

"Ayman Rostom is one of the most unique and respected beat makers working in house and techno today. His dusky grooves, heavy bass pressure and clanking drum breaks sound like they were dredged from the bottom of the river Nile, imbued with a maverick personality that shares kinship with the likes of Detroit’s Andres and... more

label: Alter
description:
Christoph De Babalon cuts onto Luke Younger’s Alter with the roiling gloom of ‘Hectic Shakes’, coming in the wake of an operatic link-up with WDIT and the reissue of his gothic jungle opus, ‘If You’re Into, I’m Out of It’,  a total classic of its genre.

Intersecting Alter’s wide-ranging tastes from an oblique new angle, ‘Hectic Shakes’ despatches a tempestuous brace... more

title_full:

              (The News Cycle)
label: The News Cycle
description:
Hyper-stepping outta nowhere, Steffi Grafs Innere Ruhe fire off three flash-forward and clinically Teutonic takes on Footwork++ on mysterious white label

Coolly resetting the game 10 years into the future, the playfully titled but seriously considered Steffi Grafs Innere Ruhe toss their hat in the ring with three cuts splicing footwork torsion with the kind of... more

title_full:
Teresa Winter

              —
              What The Night is For
            
              (The Death Of Rave)
label: The Death Of Rave
description:
Breathtaking bad dream of a second album by Teresa Winter for The Death of Rave; a uniquely allegorical study in female sexuality and occult, transgressive fascinations that comes highly recommended if youre into Cosey Fanni Tutti, Coil, Jani Christou or Jean Rollin.

Unfolding around recollections of a bad dream about being murdered by her boyfriend and... more

label: JJ Funhouse
description:
This is brilliant; a debut album from Antwerp’s Milan W, referncing nineties ambient exotica, classic Belgian synth music and outright electronic oddities. File somewhere between Pye Corner Audio, Boards of Canada, Bochum Welt and fellow Belgians, Alain Pierre and Lieven Martens.

This record is really pushing all the right buttons for us, notching the... more

label: L.I.E.S.
description:
Pivotal Parisian producer, Krikor Kouchian dubs out his widely acclaimed ‘Pacific Alley’ suite for L.I.E.S.

Practically running everything thru an echo box and emphasising their rhythmic potential, Kouchian provides a smart new angle on ‘Pacific Alley’ between the overprinting dub roil of ‘Slow Riddim’ and the cracked Jay Glass Dubs styles of ‘Snow Dub’ up top, and... more

label: Great Circles
description:
After touring L.I.E.S., Details Sound and Jack Dept., M//R returns to Great Circles with a début album of cranky technoid misfits

Establishing wonky, underwater momentum with A Twilight Birth, the album takes in acid-percolated tribal grooves on Piece 1, along with the brittle, anxious stepper Windfall, and some ‘90s sci-fi acid on Kokoon, whereas Rooms... more

label: Ghostly International
description:
Proper rave mutations from X-Altera, the killer new alias coined by Tadd Mullinx (J.T.C./SK-1/Dabrye/Charles Manier/X2/TNT).

Striking hot and delirious, but with razor cut production packing stacks of ideas into every track, X-Altera is instantly shaping up to be one of our favourite of Tadd Mullinx’s myriad projects. 

Taking inspiration from the ‘ardcore... more

title_full:
Mutant Beat Dance

              (Rush Hour)
label: Rush Hour
description:
Revolving around hot-wired sluggers, Melvin Oliphant III (Traxx), Beau Wanzer and Jason Letkiewicz, Mutant Beat Dance turn out a monstrous debut album packing 25 tracks of zig-zagging, raw electronic blatz for the dancefloor and beyond.

Including more gear than you can shake three sticks at, the MBM posse make up for lost time since their ‘PolyfonikDizko’ [2014]... more

label: Don't Be Afraid
description:
Man like Brassfoot on a cranky skank for Don’t Be Afraid, turning out his first 12” since a banner year in 2016

Under the pronged title ‘Indentured Servitude’, the NTS radio regular and London type firmly plays into the DBA dancefloor aesthetic on six skewed grooves leaning towards the most wrecked and boisterous ends of the day/night.

rRoxymore

label: Don't Be Afraid
description:
Rroxymore keeps her grooves loosely mutable and wonkily useful on Thoughts of an Introvert, Pt.2 for Don’t Be Afraid. 

She continues to trace new patterns at the edge of the dance from the swagger and psych-y bleeps of This Is Not What You Think recalling a wigged-out C2, to something like a mutant Martyn dubstep riddim in Run…Feet, whereas Mythical... more

label: Modern Love
description:
Demdike land a new 9-track doublepack for Modern Love; a delirious odyssey from UKG to angular and freakish rhythmic jackers, highly recommended if yr into their Testpressing series or anything from Errorsmith to Príncipe, Dem 2, Jon E Cash, Wiley to Joy Division, DJ Scud, Equiknoxx, Anthony ‘Shake’ Shakir or Bernard Parmegiani...

Raime mutate Eski grime, post-punk, R&B, dembow rhythms and a bank of YouTube ‘Fail’ samples on this killer twelve for Different Circles, big if yr into Jon E Cash, Rapid, Rian Treanor, Gabor Lazor, Low Jack, Photek's 'Ni-Ten-Ichi-Ryu'...

title_full:
Joy O & Ben Vince

              —
              Transition 2 / Systems Align
            
              (HESSLE AUDIO)
label: HESSLE AUDIO
description:
Joy O & Ben Vince do a canny impersonation of Bass Clef with two subtle fusions of saxophone and wriggly British bass music.

On Transition 2 they craft an infectious momentum with Ben’s zippy sax lines and brassy smears carried by sloshing bass and rustling drums in a manner also recalling recent Moritz Von Oswald works.

With Systems Align they conjure... more

label: Youth
description:
Killer debut release from FUMU, coughing up 18 sawn-off tracks of fucked hip hop, warehouse and techno on Andrew Lyster’s Youth label. Definitely mark this gadge in your one-to-watch list. 

Hailing from downwind of heavy North East industry, but currently sequestered in Manchester, FUMU is a member of the Return to Zero crew and a known... more

label: Optimo Music
description:
Tech house journeyman Phil Kieran gives up the kinky cowbell-led Polyrhythmics on Optimo Music. Check for the batacuda drums of Polyrhythmica and the percolated hustle of Polyrhythmical.
